content.question: Which of the following best explains the observed difference in mass between the grass in section <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> after <math alttext="14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days and the grass in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> after <math alttext="21" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> days?

choices.label: The grass in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> required more energy for metabolic processes than the grass in section <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The grass in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> performed more photosynthesis than the grass in section <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Only the grass in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> used energy from the seed for growth and development.

Mass lost by cell respiration in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was not replaced by photosynthesis.

content.answer: Mass lost by cell respiration in section <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was not replaced by photosynthesis.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
